justification: “Most of this work has examined self-evaluation, typically by asking participants to engage in explicit reflection on the self-descriptiveness of various (often overtly positive or negative) traits and attributes.”

measured_by: self vs mother (or distant other) encoding task
justification: “Two cross-sectional studies focusing on the self-reference effect in memory … found that rostral/perigenual ACC activity increased … during encoding for self versus mother, and increased … during encoding for self versus distant other.”
“Known developmental effects in intertemporal choice patterns, such as the rapid decrease in delay discounting from early to middle adolescence, represent additional important constraints…”

measured_by: risky choice tasks manipulating probability and outcome magnitude
justification: “By late childhood [participants] use EV at least in gain frames to make decisions … which includes sensitivity to both probability and outcome magnitude.”
